label: Letter from Sidney Jennings Legendre, January 1, 1946
description: Letter from Sidney Legendre to his brother, Armant Legendre, describing a New Years Eve party he attended and the “crazy Christmas week” they had at Medway Plantation. Sidney continues in his letter to detail the extent of his worrying about Medway Plantation and recount a story he’d heard from a friend.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter from Sidney Legendre to his brother, Armant Legendre, describing a New Years Eve party he attended and the “crazy Christmas week” they had at Medway Plantation. Sidney continues in his letter to detail the extent of his worrying about Medway Plantation and recount a story he’d heard from a friend.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
January 1, 1946
H a, Dreary Eyes,
I bet if you had received this on the day it
is being written you would not be able to see out of those
red old embers that adorn your forehead. Last night I too
my guests, Laddie, Mary, Tom Eastman, John Lee, but left Landines 
guests behind nd went to old man Kittridges for dinner. Fat
face Morris and his wife were there and we really had a time.
Ten martinis apeice and the a dinner that would sink a ship.
Three or four kind of wines, brandy etc. We arose from the table 
at eleven, caught a few more drinks and then the ceremony of
ringing the new year in came about. Ben the son was sent into
the yard to ring the old slve bell that had remained quiet
for the three years during which he had been away. At twelve
oclock Mr Kittridge shot off a gun and Ben to keep I think
from falling on his face seized the bell rope. He hung onto it
for awhile swaying hack and forth until some faithful retainer
rescued him. Everyone then returned to the dinning room to
eat Hopping John. This is a rice dish with cowpeas and is
supposed to bring you very good luck. Afterwards more champagne
and then into the car at three AM and headed for home. Just
as we were about to turn into the Medway Road a drunken figure
signaled us to stop. It was Morris, his car had a puncture and
he wanted assistance. Can you beat that for luck , he had the
puncture just where we had to slow down. Of course all the
drunks piled out of the car and started to change tires. You 
have never seen a funnier picture, they would fall down , try
and help one another up, or just quit and join thegroup that
was singing a litt e to one side.
This had been a cracy chirstmas week . I told
you about the furnace quiting. Well sir, we had stocked
the new deep freeze with meat etc. to last us the entire winter.
Fifty chickens, a dozen turkeys etc. Of course it stops
working Sunday, when no one can be found to repeiar it so
everythi g is dragged out and we try to eat up an entire winters
supply in two days before it spoils. Then Laddie and his friend
go duck shooting. They are game hogs and both try to shoot
the same duck as it flies between their blinds before the other
can get it. The result, laddie gets the charge of shot in his
face. Sent him to the doctor who said it had gone in so far
he advise him to leave it all in. Landine and Bo have been 
ill in bed with the flu, but Landines friend came to the table
or Christmas dinner andpromptly vomited on the table.
[End Page 1]
Certainly am sorry that you have become a WORRIER because
that is an awful t ing to be. If only you had liked Honolulu
we could all go back there because that is a place where I 
found worry did not exist. On my return here I started to worry
about theplantation and the fact that the ceilings were falling
and thepipes rusitng out and the rice banks breaking , besides
the cattle bogging down the dogs with distemper etc. but I
thought what would the Fuhrer do, and immediately dvine
inspiration came to me and said the Fuhrer would let someone
else do the worrying. Immediately I told Gertrude that I had
been runni g this place for 15 years and now she would take it
for the first of her ifteen years. I'll say this for her it
does not worry her at all, if a car has a punture she telephones
to Charleston and tells t  m to send out a man to fix it,
slightly expensive but saves lots of work.
Bubble Belly and I will give you warnings so you can take
to the hills when we arrive, but we will follow you there so
why run. Before I close let me tell you what Tom Eastman did
to this very stuffy friend of his. They were comming from a
party in Baltimore and Tom had asked him to spend the night with
him. On the way home Tom xxx sto ped in front of a house and
said this is a whore house lets go in. The friend said no
I am a happyly married man, I will wait in the car. Tom goes in ,
it is really his own house and he climbs into bed and sleeps
the sleep of the just. About eight in the morning the friend
sitting outside in the car is tired of waiting and rings the 
doorbell, the butler comes to the door and says "sorry but
Mr Eastman cannot be disturbed." This sap waits in the car
until about eleven when Tom emerges after having a good nights
sleep and his breakfas and says "no use going to my house it 
is too late lets go back to town." So off they go.
So long old man
[End Page 2]
